definition: content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.chinese: “晚安”伊娃說，她搬起另一把椅子。

sentences.english: The song is from Goodnight & Go single.
sentences.chinese: 這首歌曲是從晚安轉到單。

sentences.english: I said good-night and went out.
sentences.chinese: 我向他們說了聲晚安就往外走。

sentences.english: They had several dates that went no further than a good-night kiss.
sentences.chinese: 他們有許多約會，最多不超過一晚安接吻。

sentences.english: The bellhop will help you carry the suitcases to your room. Have a nice evening!
sentences.chinese: 行李員會幫您把箱子送到房間，祝您晚安。

sentences.english: When I was really little, I loved the stories "Runaway Bunny" and "Goodnight, Moon".
sentences.chinese: 特小的時候，最喜歡《逃家小兔》和《晚安，月亮》。

sentences.english: I even asked him for a goodnight kiss.
sentences.chinese: 甚至，我向他索要一個晚安之吻。

sentences.english: Befor you are going to bed I will say good night to you everyday.
sentences.chinese: 每天晚上你睡覺前，和你說晚安。

sentences.english: Everyone went into Molly's room to say good night, I think.
sentences.chinese: 我想，每人都到莫利的房間對他道晚安。

sentences.english: Rosalind kissed her mother good night.
sentences.chinese: 羅莎琳德吻了一下母親祝她晚安。

sentences.english: He cried out a goodnight to his grand-father.
sentences.chinese: 他向祖父大聲地道晚安。

sentences.english: Sorry Charlotte, it's time for us to be head in' home. Say good night, Tiana.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，夏洛特，我們得回家了說晚安吧，蒂安娜。

sentences.english: My lady turned round to wish them good-night.
sentences.chinese: 夫人回身來向他們道了晚安。

sentences.english: If you can not meet tomorrow , so good morning, good afternoon, good night.
sentences.chinese: 如果明天不能見面，那麼早安，午安，晚安。

definition: see you tomorrow/(coll., jocular) food that passes through the digestive system more or less intact (esp. enoki mushrooms)
wish you all the best! (when signing off on a correspondence)
(loanword) bye-bye/also pr. [bai1 bai1] etc/(coll.) to part ways (with sb)/(fig.) to have nothing further to do (with sb or sth)
to pay one's respects by bowing with hands in front of one's chest clasping joss sticks, or with palms pressed together/(Tw) religious ceremony in which offerings are made to a deity
